contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Only a Lad | Type = Studio album | Artist = [[Oingo Boingo]] | Cover = Oingo_Boingo-Only_a_Lad.jpg | Length = 38:12 | Released = June 19, 1981 | Recorded = December 1980 - February, 1981 | Genre = [[New Wave music|New wave]], [[ska]], [[art punk]], [[college rock]]<ref>http://www.allmusic.com/album/only-a-lad-mw0000650587</ref> | Label = [[A&M Records|A&M]] | Producer = Pete Solley and Oingo Boingo | Engineer = Steve Brown | Last album = ''[[Oingo Boingo (EP)|Oingo Boingo]]''<br />(1980) | This album = '''''Only a Lad'''''<br />(1981) | Next album = ''[[Nothing to Fear]]''<br />(1982) |}} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4.5|5}}<ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r14404}}</ref> }} '''''Only a Lad''''' is the full-length debut album by [[Oingo Boingo]], released in 1981 following their [[Oingo Boingo (EP)|self-titled EP]]. The album's musical arrangements, by vocalist [[Danny Elfman]] and guitarist [[Steve Bartek]], complete the group's switch from a [[cabaret]] act to a [[New Wave music|New Wave]] band (see ''[[Oingo Boingo#The Mystic Knights years (1972-1980)|Oingo Boingo - The Mystic Knights Years]]''). ''Only a Lad'' features complex and frequently changing [[time signature]]s and [[Key (music)|key]]s, often incorporating [[harmony|harmonies]] borrowed from jazz and 20th-century classical music; all hallmarks of Elfman's songwriting. == Background == On the cover of the album, the drawing of a cat by [[Louis Wain]] that previously appeared on the cover of the ''[[Oingo Boingo (EP)|Oingo Boingo EP]]'' is visible on the shirt of the [[scouting|scout]]. The cover is a parody of the [[Boy Scouts of America]] 1960 official handbook.<ref>http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-W2TjcIoRCxA/TWK8TPnlChI/AAAAAAAAH5Q/vjW1s4-rYJg/s1600/BoyScoutBook01.jpg</ref> == Lyrical content == The album's lyrics are noticeably more comic and ironic than many of the band's later releases. Some of the lyrics express [[right-wing]] political views, which Elfman had at the time, but no longer supports.<ref>http://www.boingo.org/articles/Encyclopedia.html</ref> The nature of some of the songs featured on the album generated mild controversy, such as the opening track ''Little Girls'' of which the music video was banned in Canada.<ref>http://graveyard-duck.com/images/boingo82c.png</ref> On songs such as "Little Girls" and "Capitalism", Elfman has since stated that his intentions were to write in jest from the perspective of various disreputable characters, adding he was "out to offend everybody".<ref>{{cite video | year = 2010 | title = Danny Elfman at Comic Con Part 3 | url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7sFK7yn0Atc | language = English | publisher = 9FingeredElf | location = San Diego, California | accessdate = 2012-02-22}}</ref> == Reception == The commercial and critical success of ''Only A Lad'' was limited; however, largely due to the backing of Los Angeles radio station [[KROQ-FM|KROQ]], it established Oingo Boingo as a permanent fixture in the [[Southern California]] music scene. The ''[[National Review]] Online'' named ''Capitalism'' as one of the "50 greatest conservative rock songs".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://article.nationalreview.com/?q=NzZkNDU5MmViNzVjNzkzMDE3NzNlN2MyZjRjYTk4YjE |title="Rockin' the Right": The 50 greatest conservative rock songs. |accessdate=2007-12-25 |last=Miller |first=John J. |coauthors= |date=May 26, 2006 |work= |publisher=[[National Review]]}}</ref> ''Capitalism'' featured in the film "[[Enron: The Smartest Guys in the Room]]" (2005). ''Only a Lad'' is a playable track on the [[PlayStation 2]] video game ''[[Guitar Hero Encore: Rocks the 80s]]''. ==Track listing== {{Tracklist | all_writing = [[Danny Elfman]], except "You Really Got Me" by [[Ray Davies]] | total_length = 38:12 | title1 = Little Girls | length1 = 3:44 | title2 = Perfect System | length2 = 3:46 | title3 = On the Outside | length3 = 3:39 | title4 = Capitalism | length4 = 3:40 | title5= [[You Really Got Me]] | length5 = 4:40 | title6 = Only a Lad | length6 = 3:56 | title7 = What You See | length7 = 3:43 | title8 = Controller | length8 = 3:24 | title9 = Imposter | length9 = 2:59 | title10 = Nasty Habits | length10 = 4:06 }} ==Personnel== ;Oingo Boingo * [[Danny Elfman]] - [[Lead vocalist|lead vocals]] * [[Steve Bartek]] - [[guitar]]s * [[Richard Gibbs]] - [[Musical keyboard|keyboards]] * Kerry Hatch - [[Bass guitar|bass]] * Johnny "Vatos" Hernandez - [[Drum kit|drums]] * Leon Schneiderman - baritone and alto saxophones * Sam "Sluggo" Phipps - tenor and soprano saxophones * [[Dale Turner (trumpeter)|Dale Turner]] - trumpet, trombone ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Boingo}} [[Category:1981 debut albums]] [[Category:Oingo Boingo albums]] [[Category:A&M Records albums]]
